a_text: Use the data the trained engineer gathers to determine what percent of display screens are bad, then determine whether to reject or accept the bulk order.

You would want to test the 150 screens and show that more than 5 % of them would be bad. You would want to find the standard deviation and then the z-score and then find what % would actually be bad. If this is more than 5% then they would be able to reject there order.

First what we need to do is obtain the number of screens that were considered bad. We then find the null and alternative hypothesis. The null would be H0: p = .005 an the alternative hypothesis would be HA: p >.005. Then we have to check if it passes the assumptions of whether the data was a random sample, whether the data was 10% less than the entire population and the success or failure condition (np > 10; and n(1-p)). We then state whether it will be distributed normally. Find the mean (which is the same as the null) and the standard deviation (sqrt of(( P0 (1-p0)/n)). Find the z statistic which is p-hat - p0 divided by the standard deviation. Find the p value from the z table an subtract than from one. If the value is smaller than alpha than reject the H0 and if it is bigger than alpha do not reject the H0. Create a conclusion see whether the 150 screens are bad.
